meanings.definition: In a manner that results in loss or defeat.
meanings.sent1: She played the game losingly, always ending up on the losing side.
meanings.sent2: He ran the race losingly, finishing last every time.
meanings.sent3: The team danced losingly around the field, pretending to lose on purpose.
meanings.sent4: The leaves fell from the tree losingly, surrendering to the wind's power.
meanings.sent5: The sun set losingly, disappearing behind the horizon in a defeat of light.

meanings.definition: In a way that lacks success or victory.
meanings.sent1: She tried to bake a cake losingly, but it turned out burnt and inedible.
meanings.sent2: He attempted the puzzle losingly, unable to solve it even after hours of trying.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased its tail losingly, never catching it no matter how hard it tried.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed losingly, never reaching its desired destination.
meanings.sent5: The student answered the question losingly, unsure of the correct response.
